timeline.message:
Issue #4683 Fix jetty-slf4j-impl for osgi

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: Keep in mind that slf4j-api is <scope>compile</scope> by default, that means this change made it go from test to compile for this project.
timeline.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: As this project is a test project, that's fine.
replies.author: janbartel

timeline.bodyText:
FYI, this dependency (jetty-slf4j-impl) is declared at the top level pom.xml with both a version and scope.
(This is just a comment, no change is being asked for)
timeline.author: joakime

timeline.bodyText: Why can't this use a jetty-logging.properties file instead?
timeline.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: It seemed more convenient to be able to run the test and pass in the log level on the command line of the test, so it is very quick to change log levels. Is there some advantage in using a jetty-logging.properties file instead?
replies.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText:
Everywhere else, if we want to change logging levels, we look for a jetty-logging.properties file and make the change, controlling more then 1 level, message escaping, etc as well.
For jetty-osgi, we have to remember to edit a source file that's 3 levels of indirection away from the problem we are working to resolve.
We used to be able to edit a log4j.xml in jetty-osgi to manage logging, but you removed that file in this PR.
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: Log4j doesn't seem to work any more in the pax exam environment combined with jetty logging that now requires the slf4j interface, so the combination you see is the only combination I could get to work. I'll try creating a jetty-logging.properties file, which I assume the jetty logging infrastructure will take care of reading and parsing? Ie, all I have to do is provide it?
replies.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText:
Correct, jetty-slf4j-impl will load it.
https://github.com/eclipse/jetty.project/blob/jetty-10.0.x/jetty-slf4j-impl/src/main/java/org/eclipse/jetty/logging/JettyLoggerConfiguration.java#L169-L194
It essentially does ...
ClassLoader.getResource("jetty-logging.properties");
to find the properties URL and then load it from that URL.
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: @joakime ok, I've modified the osgi tests so that they can use src/test/resources/jetty-logging.properties.  This is better because it gives more flexibility in setting the logging levels, but also means the chance of someone committing their changes for local testing to jetty-logging.properties is high.
replies.author: janbartel

timeline.message:
Issue #4683 Use jetty-logging.properties for osgi tests

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #4683 Update README.txt

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #4683 - cleaning up pom for clarity

Signed-off-by: Joakim Erdfelt <joakim.erdfelt@gmail.com>

replies.bodyText: For this and the other range issues you've raised we need to address this in another PR, not this one. If you're happy with the changes to enable jetty-slf4j-impl to work in osgi, please give this issue the thumbs up and open new issue to bump up osgi servlet/jsp api versions.
replies.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText:
Fair enough.
I opened issue #4736 for this.
replies.author: joakime
